page.title: 10The Old Quarry Landscove
page.content: This is at OS 763673 in our block .It was begun in 1834 by Benjamin Recca to produce{slate}for the building trade. The slate was of particularly fine quality and over 100 men were working there in 1854 when Landscove School and St.Matthews Church were built,largely to serve the families of the quarrymen.The owner toured the countryside in search of orders and his most famous order was for roofs of both Houses of Parliament in London. The quarrying ceased in 1897 when the great slate{quarries}of North Wales were able to produce thinner more uniform slate at a cheaper price. The{explosive}used here came from Powder Mills Princetown as the bill from Mr.Frean for 'rock powder'tells us.Quarrying must have been hard and dangerous work in the 19th Century.
